meanings.definition: A soft, woven fabric typically made of wool or cotton.
meanings.sent1: I love the cozy feeling of my fannel blanket on a cold night.
meanings.sent2: She wore a fannel shirt to stay warm during the hike.
meanings.sent3: The fannel scarf was so soft that it felt like a gentle hug around my neck.
meanings.sent4: The fannel curtains in the room added a touch of warmth to the decor.
meanings.sent5: The fannel material was so soft that it felt like a cloud against my skin.

meanings.definition: To clean or wipe with a fannel.
meanings.sent1: I will fannel the table to make it shiny before dinner.
meanings.sent2: She fannelled the windows to remove the dust and dirt.
meanings.sent3: He fannelled the car with such enthusiasm that it sparkled in the sun.
meanings.sent4: The maid fannelled the floors until they gleamed like mirrors.
meanings.sent5: Fannelling the dishes with care made them sparkle like new.

meanings.definition: A small piece of cloth used for cleaning or applying polish.
meanings.sent1: She used a fannel to wipe the dust off the shelves.
meanings.sent2: He always carries a fannel in his pocket for quick clean-ups.
meanings.sent3: The magician pulled a colorful fannel out of his hat during the show.
meanings.sent4: The antique dresser was polished with a soft fannel to bring out its shine.
meanings.sent5: The jeweler used a fannel to buff the silver bracelet to a brilliant shine.
